intro: Githopsis, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble cups, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a reddish tint, while its stems are sturdy and somewhat woody. Githopsis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
